summary: The V-22 Osprey is a unique military aircraft that can take off and land vertically like a helicopter but fly long distances like a plane. It was created to improve on helicopters and regular transport planes. After a long development process, it first flew in 2007. The Osprey is used by the U.S. Marine Corps, Air Force, and Navy for transport, medical evacuations, and deliveries. It has served in various missions, including in Iraq, Afghanistan, and Libya.
title: Bell Boeing V-22 Osprey
